cards.title: Wimbledon / Victorious Djokovic and runner-up Federer speak after final
cards.rawTitle: Victorious Djokovic and runner-up Federer speak after final

item.title: Victorious Djokovic and runner-up Federer speak after 2015 Wimbledon final
item.trailText: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer speak after their 2015 Wimbledon final which saw Djokovic beat the 33-year-old Swiss in four sets
item.standFirst: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer speak after their 2015 Wimbledon final which saw Djokovic beat the 33-year-old Swiss in four sets. In a match split between dry and rain-threatened, the world's best player wore down the world's favourite player 7-6, 6-7, 6-4, 6-3. Despite a sparkling performance at times, a dejected Federer said afterwards: 'It's no fun ever losing'

stillImage.caption: Reaction after Novak Djokovic beat Roger Federer to win te men's singles final at Wimbledon on Sunday. 13 July 2015 Photograph: SNTV Photograph: SNTV
stillImage.cleanCaption: Reaction after Novak Djokovic beat Roger Federer to win te men's singles final at Wimbledon on Sunday. 13 July 2015 Photograph: SNTV

cards.title: In pictures / Tour de France, stages eight and nine
cards.rawTitle: Tour de France, stages eight and nine

item.title: Tour de France, stages eight and nine
item.trailText: We round up the best photos from the weekend, and stages eight and nine. Stage eight saw Chris Froome in the yellow jersey, leading the pack on the final climb, but beaten by AG2R’s rider Alexis Vuillermoz and Peter Sagan regaining the green jersey. Stage nine was the team time trial, won by BCM, only one second in front of Team Sky
item.standFirst: We round up the best photos from the weekend, and stages eight and nine. Stage eight saw Chris Froome in the yellow jersey, leading the pack on the final climb, but beaten by AG2R’s rider Alexis Vuillermoz and Peter Sagan regaining the green jersey. Stage nine was the team time trial, won by BCM, only one second in front of Team Sky

cards.title: Mexico / Residents flee as Colima volcano erupts
cards.rawTitle: Residents flee as Colima volcano erupts

item.title: Residents forced to flee after Mexico's Colima volcano erupts
item.trailText: Hundreds of people living in the shadow of the Colima volcano in western Mexico are evacuated after a spectacular smoke and lava show raised concern the eruption could become the biggest in a century
item.standFirst: Hundreds of people living in the shadow of the Colima volcano in western Mexico are evacuated after a spectacular smoke and lava show raised concern the eruption could become the biggest in a century. Half a dozen hamlets in Colima state are affected. The Colima volcano, also know as the Volcano of Fire, has erupted more than 40 times since the 16th century

stillImage.caption: Fire Volcano erupting from San Antonio community, Colima State, Mexico, on July 12, 2015. Hundreds of people were evacuated from villages amid fears an eruption could escalate to become the biggest in a century. 13 July 2015 Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP
stillImage.cleanCaption: Fire Volcano erupting from San Antonio community, Colima State, Mexico, on July 12, 2015. Hundreds of people were evacuated from villages amid fears an eruption could escalate to become the biggest in a century. 13 July 2015 Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP

displayImages.caption: Fire Volcano erupting from San Antonio community, Colima State, Mexico, on July 12, 2015. Hundreds of people were evacuated from villages amid fears an eruption could escalate to become the biggest in a century. 13 July 2015 Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP
displayImages.altText: Fire volcano
displayImages.cleanCaption: Fire Volcano erupting from San Antonio community, Colima State, Mexico, on July 12, 2015. Hundreds of people were evacuated from villages amid fears an eruption could escalate to become the biggest in a century. 13 July 2015 Photograph: HECTOR GUERRERO/AFP

cards.title: US / Bear shot down from tree with tranquiliser dart
cards.rawTitle: Bear shot down from tree with tranquiliser dart

item.title: Bear shot down from tree with tranquiliser dart - video report
item.trailText: A 2-year-old bear resting in a tree on a university campus in Colorado is shot with a tranquiliser before falling to the ground
item.standFirst: A 2-year-old bear resting in a tree on a university campus in Colorado is shot with a tranquiliser dart before falling to the ground. Wildlife officials said the bear had been resting for four hours before they decided to tranquilise it. Crews pushed safety mats under the tree to help cushion the fall, but the bear hit the edge of the mat and bounced on to the hard ground

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for How do you get a bear down from a tree ... when no camembert is available? Photograph: guardian.co.uk

cards.title: New Horizons / Spacecraft sends images of Pluto surface
cards.rawTitle: Spacecraft sends images of Pluto surface

item.title: New Horizons spacecraft sends images of Pluto surface - video report
item.trailText: Nasa's New Horizons spacecraft has begun beaming back photographs of the surface of Pluto as it approaches
item.standFirst: Nasa's New Horizons spacecraft has begun beaming back photographs of the surface of Pluto as it approaches. The probe was less than 2.5m km from the 2,300km-wide dwarf planet on Saturday and by Tuesday, it will be taking pictures from an altitude of just 12,500km. The newly published image shows the planet's hemisphere that will soon rotate out of view

displayImages.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Pluto Photograph: guardian.co.uk

cards.title: Greece crisis / There are a number of big issues yet to be solved, says eurogroup chair
cards.rawTitle: There are a number of big issues yet to be solved, says eurogroup chair

item.title: Greece crisis: there are a number of big issues yet to be solved, says eurogroup chair
item.trailText: Eurogroup chair Jeroen Dijsselbloem says that talks over a Greece bailout have been 'very difficult'
item.standFirst: Eurogroup chair Jeroen Dijsselbloem says talks over a Greece bailout have been 'very difficult' and there are still a number of big issues that haven't been solved. Speaking after talks with eurozone finance ministers on Saturday, Dijsselbloem also confirms that talks will resume the following morning before eurozone leaders are due to meet on Sunday
